alert.note: Alert for Burleigh; Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 20 at 7:38PM CDT until June 20 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL BURLEIGH...NORTH CENTRAL MORTON AND EASTERN OLIVER COUNTIES... At 738 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles south of Washburn, or 24 miles north of Mandan, moving northwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Burleigh, north central Morton and eastern Oliver Counties, including the following locations... Double Ditch Indian Village, Sanger, Price, Lake Harmon, Nelson Lake and Cross Ranch State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
